channel.title: The Weekly Challenge
channel.description: Recent content on The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 14, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 13 | Day 14 | The gift is presented by Bob Lied. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 318. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. PWC 318 Task 2 Reverse Equals Problem Description You are given two arrays of integers, each containing the same elements as the other. Write a script to return true if one array can be made to equal to the other by reversing exactly one contiguous subarray.

item.title: Advent Calendar 2025
item.description: | 2019 | 2020 | 2021 | 2022 | 2023 | 2024 | 2025 | Here we are, kicking off another Advent season. It’s amazing to look back and see how far we’ve come - and none of it would have been possible without the energy, passion, and teamwork of everyone in Team PWC. Thanks for bringing the magic to life once again! MON

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 13, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 12 | Day 13 | Day 14 | The gift is presented by Simon Green. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 316. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Weekly Challenge: Sub circular Each week Mohammad S. Anwar sends out The Weekly Challenge, a chance for all of us to come up with solutions to two weekly tasks.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 350
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. HEADLINES 2. STAR CONTRIBUTORS 3. CONTRIBUTION STATS 4. GUESTS 5. LANGUAGES 6. CENTURION CLUB 7. DAMIAN CONWAY’s CORNER 8. ANDREW SHITOV’s CORNER 9. PERL SOLUTIONS 10. RAKU SOLUTIONS 11. PERL & RAKU SOLUTIONS HEADLINES Thank you Team PWC for your continuous support and encouragement. STAR CONTRIBUTORS Following members shared solutions to both tasks in Perl and Raku as well as blogged about it.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - Guest Contributions
item.description: As you know, The Weekly Challenge, primarily focus on Perl and Raku. During the Week #018, we received solutions to The Weekly Challenge - 018 by Orestis Zekai in Python. It was pleasant surprise to receive solutions in something other than Perl and Raku. Ever since regular team members also started contributing in other languages like Ada, APL, Awk, BASIC, Bash, Bc, Befunge-93, Bourne Shell, BQN, Brainfuck, C3, C, CESIL, Chef, COBOL, Coconut, C Shell, C++, Clojure, Crystal, CUDA, D, Dart, Dc, Elixir, Elm, Emacs Lisp, Erlang, Excel VBA, F#, Factor, Fennel, Fish, Forth, Fortran, Gembase, Gleam, GNAT, Go, GP, Groovy, Haskell, Haxe, HTML, Hy, Idris, IO, J, Janet, Java, JavaScript, Julia, K, Kap, Korn Shell, Kotlin, Lisp, Logo, Lua, M4, Maxima, Miranda, Modula 3, MMIX, Mumps, Myrddin, Nelua, Nim, Nix, Node.

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 12, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 11 | Day 12 | Day 13 | The gift is presented by Robbie Hatley. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 314. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. For those not familiar with "The Weekly Challenge", it is a weekly programming puzzle with two parts, cycling every Sunday. You can find it here:

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 11, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 10 | Day 11 | Day 12 | The gift is presented by Adam Russell. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 313. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Reverse Broken Keys for Letters The examples used here are from the weekly challenge problem statement and demonstrate the working solution. Part 1: Broken Keys You have a broken keyboard which sometimes type a character more than once.
